required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Argatroban for Preventing Occlusion and Restenosis After Intracranial and Extracranial Artery Stenting
clinical_study.official_title: Phase 4 Study of Argatroban for Preventing Occlusion and Restenosis After Intracranial and Extracranial Artery Stenting

brief_summary.textblock: Argatroban is a selective thrombin inhibitor, and previous study had suggested that argatroban use post PCI could potentially prevent reocclusion. But there has no study on large sample of argatroban treated restenosis post cranial stenting. This study will test the safety and efficacy of the argatroban on prevent occlusion and restenosis in patients with intracranial and extracranial artery stenting.

detailed_description.textblock: The risk of restenosis post intracranial and extracranial artery stenting is 20-40%, therefore, in the past, aspirin and clopidogrel were performed as anticoagulant therapy post stenting.But this treatment had limited effectiveness upon restenosis. Argatroban is a selective thrombin inhibitor, and previous study had suggested that argatroban use post PCI could potentially prevent reocclusion. But there has no study on large sample of argatroban treated restenosis post cranial stenting. This study will test the safety and efficacy of the argatroban on prevent occlusion and restenosis in patients with intracranial and extracranial artery stenting.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Occlusion and Restenosis at One Year
primary_outcome.description: Stenosis detected by DSA(digital subtraction angiography),CTA(CT angiography)or MRA(MR angiography)was measured according to NASCET(North American Symptomatic Carotid Endarterectomy Trial)method.Concretely, NASCET stenosis is calculated from the ratio of the linear luminal diameter of the narrowest segment of the diseased portion of the artery to the diameter of the artery beyond any poststenotic dilatation: NASCET=(1-md/C)×100%

secondary_outcome.description: NIHSS and mRS are widely used stroke deficit assessment tools. Most clinical stroke-related trials require a baseline and outcome severity assessment. The baseline of mRS is rank 0, NIHSS 0; the severity of mRS is 6, NIHSS 42. AS many patients have one or more strokes before they perform stenting, this study selected NIHSS and mRS as the supplementary materials to estimate the stroke deficit of patients and to reflect the therapeutic effect and safety of stenting and argatroban therapy. These two scales are performed according to the guidance before and after stenting and argatroban therapy.

arm_group.description: Patients who underwent intracranial and extracranial artery stenting were randomly chosen to receive continuous infusions of argatroban for 2 days before and 3 days after stenting, with accompanied aspirin and clopidogrel treatment.
Patients who underwent intracranial and extracranial artery stenting were randomly chosen to receive only aspirin and clopidogrel treatment.

intervention.description: Intravenous Infusion, 20mg/day for 2 days before and 3 days after stenting, (10mg/3h, twice a day), with accompanied aspirin and clopidogrel treatment
Patients who underwent intracranial and extracranial artery stenting were randomly chosen to receive only aspirin and clopidogrel treatment.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- For extracranial artery lesion, stenting was considered for symptomatic stenosis≥50% or asymptomatic stenosis≥70%; according to intracranial artery lesion, stenting was considered for symptomatic stenosis≥70% in invalid patients after intensive medical therapy.
- Successfully had intracranial or extracranial artery stenting
Exclusion Criteria:
- Evidence of hemorrhagic brain infarction, intracranial and extracranial hematoma, or intraventricular hemorrhage, or Gastrointestinal ulcers in 3 months
- Hypersensitivity to contrast agent
- Malignant hypertension
- Difficult to perform the intracranial and extracranial artery stenting
- Severe hepatic or cardiac disorders, infectious disorders, dehydration, etc.
- Serum creatinine >1.5 mg/dL
- Hypersensitivity to test drugs
- Difficult to hand follow-up visit

overall_official.affiliation: Department of Neurology, Jinling Hospital, Nanjing University School of Medicine

facility.name: Department of Neurology, Jinling Hospital, Nanjing University School of Medicine

participant_flow.recruitment_details: The present study was a single-center, open-label, prospective, randomized, controlled pilot one. Enrollment of participants began in August 2010, and completed in August 2011. The local ethics committee approved the study, and written informed consent was obtained in all recruited patients.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: The present study was a single-center, open-label, prospective, randomized, controlled pilot one. Enrollment of participants began in August 2010, and completed in August 2011. The local ethics committee approved the study, and written informed consent was obtained in all recruited patients.

group.title: Argatroban Group
group.description: Patients who underwent intracranial and extracranial artery stenting were randomly chosen to receive continuous infusions of argatroban for 2 days before and 3 days after stenting, with accompanied aspirin and clopidogrel treatment. Argatroban: Intravenous Infusion, 20mg/day for 2 days before and 3 days after stenting, (10mg/3h, twice a day), with accompanied aspirin and clopidogrel treatment

group.description: Patients who underwent intracranial and extracranial artery stenting were randomly chosen to receive only aspirin and clopidogrel treatment. non-argatroban treated group: Patients who underwent intracranial and extracranial artery stenting were randomly chosen to receive only aspirin and clopidogrel treatment.

reported_events.desc: Serious and Other [Non-Serious] Adverse Events were not collected

certain_agreements.pi_employee: All Principal Investigators ARE employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
